text: [MUSIC PLAYING]

JEREMY UTLEY: This
program is designed

to give you a working knowledge
of the design thinking process
that we teach at the d.school.

It's meant to equip you
with some understanding

of the way the design thinking
approach to innovation works.

JUSTIN FERRELL: My particular
area of design thinking

is how you use design thinking
for organizational change,

and particularly around
introducing new ways of working

in order to help
your organization get

to new outcomes, to continue to
serve the purpose that you're

meant to serve as
the world changes.

PERRY KLEBAHN: You'll start
with some basics of design

and will go through all
the different disciplines
in design.

And you'll learn the
tools and techniques

and will build your
skills as a practitioner.

JEREMY UTLEY: We think
that as important

as the theory and
the application

are, equally important
to that is your ability

to take the tools
that you're learning

and infuse them into what we
call a daily creative practice.

KATHRYN SEGOVIA:
Here is what you

need to know about
your daily practice.

You need to carve out some
time to do this every day.

Maybe you're too focused
on getting the best

idea or the right
idea, and we're

going to help you shift
through this practice
to focus on quantity of ideas.

JEREMY UTLEY: But
the course ultimately

isn't only about you
catalyzing true breakthrough
work in an organization.

It's about enlisting
the enthusiasm of others

and leading people
through these tools.

DAVID KELLEY: I may
be a bit biased,

but you have the
A-team here, and I'm

sure you're going to have a
great experience of learning

and enjoying yourself
through this program.

So so long from
me, and good luck.
